Hospital.WareHouse

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hospital.WareHouse.Item
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ItemFactory, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExpiringItem, Plaster

    public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, ItemFactory
    An item in our hospital (eg medication)

      • getExpirationTime

        public Time getExpirationTime()
        The date at which this item expires
        Returns:
        a Time-object with the expiration-date

      • isExpired

        public boolean isExpired(Time currentTime)
                  throws ArgumentIsNullException
        Indicates whether this item has expired at the given time
        Parameters:
        currentTime - the time at which to check
        Returns:
        true if the item is expired at the given time
        Throws:
        ArgumentIsNullException - the given time argument was null

      • setExpirationTime

        protected void setExpirationTime(Time expirationTime)
                          throws NeedsNoExpirationTimeException,
                                 ArgumentIsNullException,
                                 CannotChangeException
        Sets the expiration date for this item
        Parameters:
        expirationTime - the time at which this item expires
        Throws:
        NeedsNoExpirationTimeException - this function was called even though the item needs no expiration date
        ArgumentIsNullException - the given time object was null
        CannotChangeException - the expiration date was already set
